titleStmt.title: The loyall subjects lamentation for Londons perversenesse, in the malignant choice of some rotten members, on Tuesday the 19. of March 1661.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A91839 of text R210249 in the English Short Title Catalog (Thomason 669.f.27[3]). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 4 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 1 1-bit group-IV TIFF page image.

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

titleStmt.title: The loyall subjects lamentation for Londons perversenesse, in the malignant choice of some rotten members, on Tuesday the 19. of March 1661.
titleStmt.author: Rise, Augustin, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: Verse - "Oh horrid monsters! what strange newes is here,".
Annotation on Thomason copy: "March 28"; the second 1 in the imprint date has been altered in MS to "0".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
